abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews dance work by choreographer William Forsythe, performed by the Forsythe Company, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.
snippet: In William Forsythe’s “I don’t believe in outer space” at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, nothing is innocent.
lead_paragraph: In William Forsythe’s “I don’t believe in outer space” at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, nothing is innocent.

headline.main: Plodding and Talking, All With Eyebrow Arched
headline.print_headline: Plodding and Talking, All With Eyebrow Arched
headline.seo: William Forsythe’s ‘I don’t believe in outer space’ - Review
